name: 01-Introduction
content:
Financial-Account-Fraud-Detection

Project Overview

Objective:

  • The primary goal is to detect fraudulent account activities by analyzing financial transaction patterns. The system aims to provide early warning signals for suspicious behaviors such as abnormal balances, unusual authorization amounts, or inconsistent spending limits.

Approach:

  1. Data Profiling – Explore distributions of key variables (account balance, credit limits, transaction amounts).
  2. Data Preparation – Clean, normalize, and engineer features (e.g., transaction frequency, rolling balances).
  3. Model Training – Apply H2O Distributed Random Forest (DRF) for supervised fraud classification.
  4. Evaluation – Measure performance using precision, recall, F1-score, and ROC-AUC.
  5. Deployment & Analysis – Generate fraud predictions and visualize fraud trends across accounts.
  • Significance:
  • Fraudulent transactions can result in heavy financial losses and reputational damage. An automated, data-driven detection system improves security, reduces losses, and enhances trust in financial operations.

Benefits:

  • Real-time detection of suspicious transactions.
  • Reduced false positives compared to rule-based systems.
  • Actionable insights for compliance and audit teams.
  • Scalability across large volumes of account transactions.

Expected Outcomes:

  • Accurate fraud classification with >90% recall.
  • Interactive dashboards for fraud pattern visualization.
  • Early detection signals to mitigate fraud risk.
description: Introduction to Financial Fraud Detection Project
